intro: Convolvulus cordifolius, commonly known as heartleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink to purple. Native to regions of southern Africa, it thrives in warm, sunny environments and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. The plant is a climbing vine that can reach lengths of several meters, using its tendrils to support itself. Its flowers are not only ornamental but also attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
